VLIB_recursiveFilterHoriz1stOrder

Detailed Description


Functions

int32_t VLIB_recursiveFilterHoriz1stOrder (uint8_t *out, const uint8_t *in, const int32_t width, const int32_t height, const int16_t weight, const uint8_t *boundaryLeft, const uint8_t *boundaryRight, uint8_t *scratch)

Function Documentation

int32_t VLIB_recursiveFilterHoriz1stOrder ( uint8_t *  out,
const uint8_t *  in,
const int32_t  width,
const int32_t  height,
const int16_t  weight,
const uint8_t *  boundaryLeft,
const uint8_t *  boundaryRight,
uint8_t *  scratch 
)

Description
This function implements the 1st order horizontal IIR filter on an 8-bit input array.
Parameters:
[out] *out Filter output image (UQ8.0)
[in] *in Input luma image (UQ8.0)
[in] width Input Width (SQ31.0)
[in] height Image height (SQ31.0)
[in] weight Filter coefficient (SQ15.0)
[in] *boundaryLeft Array of left-boundary values (UQ8.0)
[in] *boundaryRight Array of right-boundary values (UQ8.0)
[in] *scratch Scratch buffer (UQ8.0)
Assumptions
  • The scratch buffer must be at least 8 x width bytes.
  • The image width and height needs to be a multiple of 4.
  • The input and output image buffers need to be double-word aligned.
Benchmarks:
See VLIB_Test_Report.html for cycle and memory information.
